snippet: The accusations against the landlord, Yeshaya Wasserman, involved alleged practices in eight rent-regulated properties with 181 apartments in Flatbush and Crown Heights.
abstract: New York State Tenant Protection Unit reaches settlement with Brooklyn landlord Yeshaya Wasserman, who is accused of harassing long-time tenants in eight rent-regulated properties; settlement requires Wasserman to pay for independent monitor to oversee his business practices and to set up $60,000 compensation fund to pay claims to mistreated tenants.
lead_paragraph: The accusations against the landlord, Yeshaya Wasserman, involved alleged practices in eight rent-regulated properties with 181 apartments in Flatbush and Crown Heights.

headline.main: Settlement in Investigation of Brooklyn Landlord Over Rent-Regulated Units
